events.originalText: Mauritanian president Maaouya Ould Sid'Ahmed Taya was overthrown in a military coup while he attended the funeral of King Fahd of Saudi Arabia.
events.subtitle: Maaouya Ould Sid'Ahmed Taya
events.headline: Mauritanian President Overthrown in Military Coup at King Fahd's Funeral

events.originalText: The Sky Tower (pictured), the tallest free-standing structure in the Southern Hemisphere at 328 m (1,076 ft), opened in Auckland, New Zealand.
events.subtitle: Sky Tower (Auckland)
events.headline: Sky Tower, Tallest Structure in Southern Hemisphere, Opens in Auckland

events.originalText: Tandy Corporation announced the TRS-80, one of the world's first mass-produced personal computers.
events.subtitle: Tandy Corporation
events.headline: Tandy Corporation Announces TRS-80 Personal Computer

events.originalText: Before the House Un-American Activities Committee of the United States House of Representatives, former spy turned government informer Whittaker Chambers accused U.S. State Department official Alger Hiss of being a communist and a Soviet spy.
events.subtitle: House Un-American Activities Committee
events.headline: Whittaker Chambers Accuses Alger Hiss of Being a Communist Spy

events.originalText: World War II: Italian forces began a conquest of British Somaliland, capturing the region in 16 days.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: Italian Forces Conquer British Somaliland in 16 Days

events.originalText: African-American athlete Jesse Owens (pictured) won the first of his four gold medals at the Berlin Olympics, dashing Nazi leaders' hopes of Aryan domination at the games
events.subtitle: African Americans
events.headline: Jesse Owens Wins First Gold Medal at Berlin Olympics

events.originalText: Jiddu Krishnamurti (pictured), believed by some Theosophists to be a likely candidate for the messianic "World Teacher", dissolved the Order of the Star, the organisation established to support him.
events.subtitle: Jiddu Krishnamurti
events.headline: Jiddu Krishnamurti Dissolves Order of the Star Organization

events.originalText: An agricultural workers' strike in Wheatland degenerated into a riot, becoming one of the first major farm-labor confrontations in California.
events.subtitle: Wheatland, California
events.headline: Agricultural Workers' Strike in Wheatland Turns into Riot

events.originalText: Macedonian rebels in Kruševo proclaimed a republic, which existed for ten days before Ottoman forces destroyed the town.
events.subtitle: Internal Macedonian Revolutionary Organization
events.headline: Macedonian Rebels Proclaim Republic in Kruševo, Destroyed by Ottoman Forces

events.originalText: Indian Rebellion: An eight-day siege of a fortified outbuilding in Arrah occupied by 68 defenders against more than 10,000 men ended when a relief party dispersed the besiegers.
events.subtitle: Indian Rebellion of 1857
events.headline: Siege in Arrah Ends with Relief Party Dispersing Besiegers

events.originalText: Pope Stephen IX was crowned as pope.
events.subtitle: Pope Stephen IX
events.headline: Pope Stephen IX Crowned as Pope
